chargeHist.descr: Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Failure to Pay for Service (<=$500)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanna R. Tondola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • County Retail Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shanna R. Tondola

records.addlTxt: Default Judgment - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

10:07 AM case called. Defendant Shanna R. Tondola not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is in Taycheedah but they did not connect to Zoom. State moves to amend to a county ordinance for retail theft and asks the court to default the defendant and assess court costs based on the non appearance. So ordered.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

Conditions:
No contact with VP Nails

11:25am Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shanna R. Tondola appeared by video, in custody from the Monroe County Jail without counsel. Defendant advised of right to attorney and right to attorney. Bond the set. Defendant is being transferred to a different facility soon. She is allowed to appear via Zoom for her next hearing. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/22/22 at 1:30pm
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with VP Nails.
